info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 7:33PM CDT until July 29 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central, southwest, and west central Nebraska, including the following counties, in central Nebraska, Custer. In southwest Nebraska, Lincoln. In west central Nebraska, Logan.
* WHEN...Until 1045 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arnold, Callaway, Logan, Finchville, Pleasant Hill and Milldale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Custer, NE; Lincoln, NE; Logan, NE
